isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - CRANKSHAFT DAMPER AND/OR FRONT SEAL (V-8), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: CRANKSHAFT DAMPER AND/OR FRONT SEAL (V-8), REPLACE
wtsproc.config: Radiator assembly includes radiator, charge air cooler, and shroud.

step1.para: Chock wheels. Open hood.
Disconnect all ground cables.
Drain engine coolant.
Disconnect hood wiring harness (in line). At left side of engine, near starting motor, remove wire loom support clamps and lay loom on grille.
Use suitable device to support hood, disconnect hood cables and springs, and lay hood on support.
Remove hood hinge pivot pins.
Remove hood using 2 people.
Disconnect block heater plug from bumper, if equipped, and remove bumper.
Remove charge air hose from intake y-pipe, and remove charge air pipe from radiator frame.

note.para: Tape upper bolt retaining pipe to radiator frame.

step1.para: Remove left side radiator stabilizer strut from frame support bracket. Remove hood support bracket with strut from radiator frame for access to power steering reservoir
Remove power steering reservoir from radiator frame. Lay reservoir aside and secure.

note.para: Do not open power steering system.

step1.para: Remove charge air cooler pipe/hoses from cooler and turbocharger.
Remove all coolant hoses necessary to remove radiator assembly.
Disconnect wiring from surge tank.
If equipped with automatic transmission, remove cooler lines at radiator and cap ends.
Disconnect upper radiator support struts at radiator frame.
Remove fan/clutch assembly using special tools.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly.
Disconnect right side radiator support strut at frame support bracket.
Remove lower radiator support bolt.
Remove radiator assembly.
Remove serpentine belt.
Remove crankshaft damper using puller.
Remove front seal and wear ring on damper.
Install front seal and wear ring.
Install crankshaft damper and torque bolt.
Install serpentine belt.
Install radiator assembly.
Install lower radiator support bolt.
Connect right side radiator support strut.
Remove lifting device.
Install fan/clutch assembly.
Connect upper radiator support struts.
Install transmission cooler lines, if equipped.
Connect wiring to surge tank.
Install all coolant hoses.
Install power steering reservoir.
Install hood support bracket with radiator support strut to radiator frame.
Install charge air pipes.
Install hood, hood pivot pins and support cables.
Connect hood assembly wiring and secure harness.
Install bumper and block heater, if applicable.
Fill engine coolant.
Connect battery.
Check engine oil level, start engine, and check for leaks.
If auto transmission equipped, check fluid level.
Close hood and remove wheel chocks.
